div.p: A Coppie of a LETTER, Read in the Houſe of COMMONS: SENT From Maſter SAMPFORD, High Sheriffe of the Countie of Somerſet, and the Committee there, of their weekly proceedings, in ſearching the Recuſants Houſes.
Alſo the number of ſuch Ammunition as was taken in their Houſes, and ſent to the Caſtle at Taunton

closer.signed: Hen. Elſyng, Cler. Farl. D. Com.

div.p: Auguſt 26. Printed at London for W. Ley. 1642.

div.head: A Coppie of a Letter read in the houſe of Commons, ſent from Maſter Sampford, high Sheriffe of the Countie of Somerſet, and the Committee there, of their weekly Proceedings, &c.
div.p: WEE have ſent you our Weeks taske, and an account of the ſervice we were commanded by both Houſes, viz.

FIR'ST, on Munday, the fifteenth of Auguſt, early in the Morning wee with the attendants of the Trained Bands came to Taunton none knowing our intent, (the Major excepted) after an houres reſpite, Baronet Portman, Mr. Coles, Mr. Pyne, and others were ſent for by us, who immediately came and aſſiſted us with Horſe and Foot: Then after conſultation
wee ſearched one Maſter Brownes houſe, a Recuſant, and found therein 60. mens Armour, and o •• er Ammunition of Pike and Muſquet, in Alder •••
〈◊〉
houſe twentie mens Armour of Pike and 〈…〉
Tuckers houſe, the Receiver of the Biſhop of Wincheſter's Rents, and Steward of his Courts one handered mens Armour for Horſe and Foot, alſo two barrells of Gun-powder, fifty great Saddles; with ſhot of all ſorts. Then we marched to the out-pariſhes, as Badford, Nenea • d, Langford, and Wellington, and in Badford, ſearching Captaine Collins houſe, found therein ten mens Armour, and in Maſter Eaſons houſe of the ſame pariſh five mens Armour: at Nyneard, ſearching Maſter Sheeres houſe, found therein 40 mens Armour of pike and muſquet: And at Langford, at Maſter Prowſes houſe twenty mens Armour; and at Wellington in Maſter Strawbridge's houſe fifty mens Armour.

On Tueſday, the ſixteen we marched to Bridgwater, where we were entertained by the Major and Aldermen, and found therein at ſome private gentlemens houſes about ſixty mens Armour, and other Ammunition, and left it in charge with the Major and Aldermen, to bee ready at the King and Parliaments command.

On Wedneſday the ſeventeenth we marched to We •• , and comming within a mile of the Towne, wee were met by the Major and Aldermen, and accompanyed by them into the Towne, and quartered our ſelves, in ſearching two in each ſtreet, and began firſt and ſearched the Biſhops houſe, but found nothing there. But in Doctor Weſtons houſe wee found neare upon one hundred mens Armour; in Eſquire Roſes houſe forty
mens armour, in Eſquire Pollards houſe forty mens armour, in Maſter Iohnſons houſe twenty mens armourin Maſter Tomkins houſe fifty mens armour, and wee gave imediate charge to have them carryed to Taunton Caſtle, which was ſo done.

On Thurſday the 18, we marched to the City of Bath, accompanyed with Mr. Barret of Cotford, Maſter Baſſet Maſter Harrington, Maſter Bampfield, and others, and there ſearched Sir. George Ives houſe but found none there, but one of his ſervants ſaid he had ſent all his Armour to Sir Ralph Hopton's houſe and was going thither to ſojourne with his wife and family: Then wee ſearched one Maſter Ceaſars houſe, neare the Earle of Rutlands Caſtle, and found therein 100 mens armour, five light horſes, and ſufficient ammunition for twenty horſe more, and about 10000. pound in money: and afterward wee went to Sir Edward Rodneys houſe, where we concluded that ſome of us ſhould the next day with a ſufficient Company of Horſe and foot, ſearch theſe Townes here underwritten, viz.
Glaſt • nbury,
Ilcheſter,
Ilminſter.
Shipton Mallet,
Chard,
Crewkerne.
South, and North Petherton, &c.
The Sheriffe requeſted that by reaſon of his age he might be excuſed of the ſaid attendance, and that his ſervants ſhould wait on them where they pleaſed, which was granted.
Sir Edward Rodney and Captaine Brookes immediatly ſent warrants for the Trained Bands about them to give their attendance the day following.

On Fryday the 19 two companies of foot came to Sir Edward Rodney's houſe and ſearched the Towne of Glaſtenbury, and found therein forty mens armour, and at the end of Glaſtenbury Doune in Farmer Twiſts houſe 100 mens armour of horſe and foot, and after examination, confeſſed it was his Landlords armour, Sir Iohn Stowells, and hath had it within this ſixe weeks, nevertheleſſe committed him to Ilcheſter Goale for his ſecreſie.

This day alſo Mr. Phillips, Mr. Light, Mr. Hodgs, & Mr. Trevillion met at Ilcheſter, and a Trained band attended on them and ſearched one Mr. Vincents, and Mr. Forteſcues houſes, & found in each of them 40 mens armour a peice, and in Kingſton pariſh being the Earle of Barkeſhires were found in a barne 10 light horſes, 100 Saddles 100 ſwords and 40 muſquets which was immediately ſent to Taunton. In Ilminſter and Shipton Mallet, there are divers other poore Recuſants, but none able to buy or maintaine armes.

This day alſo at Chard there met Mr. Martine, Sr Henry Roſewell, Mr Preston, and Mr Symes who were accompanyied with the trained Bands, and ſearched the Parſon of the Pariſh his houſe, and found there 50 mens Armour, in Mr Coleman's houſe 100 mens Armour, in Sir William Button's Ladies Houſe 150 mens Armour, in Mr Hill's houſe 50 mens Armour; All which was likewiſe ſent to Taunton Caſtle.

The ſame day Mr. Meredith, Mr. Fowler and others were appointed to ſearch at Crookehorne and thereabouts, who came to the Lord Paulet's houſe, but the Gentry and ſervants therein would not obey their authoritie but bid them be gone otherwiſe they would
let bullets fly amongſt them, and would not let any of the Trained Bands to enter the ſaid houſe: Hereupon one of the Trained Band ſhort a bullett againſt the Port-houſe doore, nevertheleſſe they would not open it, at length they brake it open and entred perforce & one of the Trained Band killed, there was above fifty perſons therein Gentry and ſervants, there was found 10 light horſe and 150 mens Armour or thereabouts.
Then wee came to North and South Petherton & in Sir John Cary's houſe found 20 mens Armour; All which number of Armes amounting unto, viz.
All which wee left in the Caſtle at Taunton under the Cuſtody of the Maior and Aldermen of the ſaid Towne with a ſufficient guard for the ſafe keeping thereof.

Wee therefore humbly pray the Honourable Aſſembly in Parliament, that the Ammunition taken aforeſaid may not be carried out of the County but that it may be diſtributed and imployed in the defence of the Countrey. And wee ſhall daily pray for the happy proceedings of both Houſes.

closer.signed:
Your affectionate friends,
H. Sampford.
I. Stroud.
F. Coles.
J. Horner.
A. Popham.
A. Pyne.
Hen. Elſing Cler. Parl. D. Com.
